summary: This document is an email chain between attorneys Andrew Patel and Jill Shellow and federal prosecutors regarding inmate Johnny Contreras, who was housed near Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) at the time of Epstein's death. The attorneys offer to arrange a proffer session for Contreras to share his observations with investigators.

persons.name: Jill Shellow
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with federal prosecutors about arranging a proffer session for her client, Johnny Contreras, regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Andrew Patel
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with federal prosecutors to inform them that his client, Johnny Contreras, is willing to speak to investigators about his observations regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death at the MCC.

persons.name: Johnny Contreras
persons.context: Inmate housed on the same tier and across the hall from Jeffrey Epstein's cell at the MCC at the time of Epstein's death. He is willing to speak to investigators about his observations.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the death investigation. He died while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

persons.name: Donald Yannella
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

connections.description: Andrew Patel is acting as legal counsel for Johnny Contreras, offering to arrange a proffer session for him with investigators.
Jill Shellow is co-counsel with Andrew Patel representing Johnny Contreras regarding the Epstein death investigation.
Attorneys working together from the same law office (80 Broad Street, Suite 1900) on the representation of Johnny Contreras.
Contreras was housed in a cell on the same tier and across the hall from Epstein's cell at the MCC at the time of Epstein's death.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by hanging while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: Initial Attorney Outreach to Prosecutors
events.description: Attorney Andrew Patel emails federal prosecutors to inform them that his client, Johnny Contreras, is willing to speak about his observations regarding Epstein's death.

events.title: Prosecutors Agree to Proffer Session
events.description: Federal prosecutors respond, confirming they understand Contreras is willing to meet for a proffer session limited to information about Epstein's death, and ask to schedule it.

locations: 80 Broad Street, Suite 1900, New York, NY 10004
keyFacts: Inmate Johnny Contreras was housed on the same tier and across the hall from Jeffrey Epstein's cell at the MCC at the time of Epstein's death.
Contreras's attorneys offered to arrange a proffer session for him to speak with investigators about his observations, though he did not see the hanging itself.
The email chain shows coordination between defense attorneys and federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding the death investigation.
Contreras had recently been returned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) in the MCC at the time of the correspondence.
The proffer session was to be limited strictly to information Contreras had regarding Epstein's death.
